I haven't logged the feature request, mainly because I might not be using t=
he right tool for the job.  What I would like to see is what I described.

=
With JUnit 3, I adopted the test nomenclature of something on the order of:=


testMyMethod_withNullParam1()
testMyMethod_withXandYparams()

etc.

that =
would let me see within the test report (particularly a continuous integrat=
ion test report) what exactly failed.  If the null parameter failed its che=
ck I'd have to fix one thing (boundary checking), but if the XandYparams ve=
rsion failed then I knew something may be wrong with the algorithm.

With t=
he particular Theory I've written I need to know not only the class that wa=
s tested, but the attribute that did not follow the contracts for using the=
 base class.  With only one failure that can't happen.

I didn't think Rule=
s was the right way to go, because the MethodRule objects were applied to t=
he tests within that same class (unless I'm missing something).

Theories a=
t least gives me the coverage and assurance I'm after, but I'd like to get =
away from writing to System.out to figure out exactly what failed.  I would=
 also like to be able to see all my failures at once instead of only after =
fixing the last failure.
